en: [Drawing of mid-18th century Cherokee segmented domestic structure] / [by Thomas Whyte]

This is a drawing of a Cherokee segmented domestic structure from the mid-18th century based on archaeological excavations by the University of Tennessee at Overhill Cherokee sites on the lower Little Tennessee River Valley. Excavations of Overhill Cherokee villages were conducted by the University of Tennessee between 1967 and 1983 as part of the Tellico Archaeological Project. Excavations continued until 1983, and laboratory studies and report preparation continued until 1987. The excavations were conducted in anticipation of the flooding of the lower Little Tennessee River Valley, in eastern Tennessee, by the Tellico Dam Reservoir. The excavations were conducted under contract with the National Park Service and the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA).

Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

none: [Drawing of mid-18th century Cherokee segmented domestic structure] / [by Thomas Whyte] : page 1

body.value: Artist drawing of Cherokee segmented domestic structure, mid-18th century, based on archaeological excavations by the University of Tennessee at Overhill Cherokee sites on the Lower Little Tennessee River Valley and contemporary historic descriptions. Drawing by Thomas Whyte. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum. This document consists of one image only.
